src:
Ma'ruf Amin soal Kabinet: Jokowi, Saya, NU, dan Muhammadiyah Tak Puas
01 Nov 2019, 21:28 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Wakil Presiden Ma'ruf Amin mengakui banyak pihak yang kecewa soal susunan Kabinet Indonesia Maju. Bahkan, menurutnya, Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) hingga NU-Muhammadiyah juga tidak puas dengan susunan kabinet.
"Pak Jokowi juga tidak puas, saya juga tidak puas, NU tidak puas, Muhammadiyah tidak puas, karena memang belum semua bisa terakomodasi karena memang tempatnya tidak banyak," ujar Ma'ruf di kantor Wapres, Jakarta, seperti dikutip dari Antara, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Dia meminta seluruh pihak memaklumi jika ada yang tidak puas atas penyusunan Kabinet Indonesia Maju.
"Jadi ketidakpuasan pasti ada. Karena itu, saya kira bisa dimaklumi. Ya, itu kan biasa, memang itu bagian, ketidakpuasan, saya juga bilang yang tidak puas itu memang banyak," ujarnya.
"Karena tempatnya memang tidak banyak, itu pun sudah ada wakil menteri. Jadi sudah ada saluran, tapi juga yang tidak tertampung kan masih banyak," tuturnya.
text:
Ma'ruf Amin about the Cabinet: Jokowi, I, NU and Muhammadiyah are not satisfied
Nov 01 2019, 21:28 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Vice President Ma'ruf Amin admitted that many people were disappointed about the composition of the Advanced Indonesian Cabinet. In fact, according to him, President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) to the NU-Muhammadiyah was also not satisfied with the composition of the cabinet.
"Mr. Jokowi is also not satisfied, I am also not satisfied, NU is not satisfied, Muhammadiyah is not satisfied, because indeed not all can be accommodated because there are not many places," Ma'ruf said at the Vice President's office, Jakarta, as quoted by Antara on Friday (Friday) 11/1/2019).
He asked all parties to understand if anyone was not satisfied with the preparation of the Advanced Indonesian Cabinet.
"So there must be dissatisfaction. Because of that, I think it can be understood. Yes, that's normal, indeed it is part, dissatisfaction, I also say there are indeed many dissatisfied ones," he said.
"Because there are not many places, there are already deputy ministers. So there are channels, but there are still many that are not accommodated," he said.
